name: Teriyaki Salmon with Soba Noodles
description: Glazed salmon fillets served over cold soba noodles tossed with edamame, carrots, and a sesame dressing.
instructions: Prepare Teriyaki Glaze: Combine glaze ingredients (soy sauce, mirin, sake, brown sugar, garlic, ginger, honey) in a saucepan. Heat over medium, stirring until sugar dissolves. Simmer 5-7 min. Optional: Thicken with cornstarch/water slurry, cook 2 min more. Cool slightly.
Marinate Salmon: Place salmon in a dish. Pour half the glaze over, reserve the rest. Marinate refrigerated for 30 min to 2 hours.
Cook Soba Noodles: Cook soba per package directions. Drain, rinse under cold water, set aside.
Prepare Sesame Dressing: Whisk dressing ingredients (soy sauce, vinegar, sesame oil, honey, ginger, garlic, sesame seeds) in a large bowl.
Toss Noodle Salad: Add cooked soba noodles, edamame, and shredded carrots to the dressing. Toss to coat.

Cook Salmon: Preheat griddle or large skillet (medium-high). Brush with sesame oil. Remove salmon from marinade (discard marinade). Cook salmon 4-5 min per side until done. Brush with reserved glaze during the last minute.
Serve: Divide noodle salad among plates/containers. Top with a salmon fillet. Garnish with sliced green onions and extra sesame seeds.
cookNotes: Can be served warm or cold.
